page.title: 08Ecology
page.content: {Flora:}The{landscape}has changed considerably in the last decade due to destruction of the hedgerow trees by {Dutch Elm}disease.Wayside flowers have become less varied owing to the use of {chemical weedkillers}on the farmland. The common weeds as they were once known have now become popular{garden {flowers,}such as poppy, thistles, cow-parsley and herbs like feverfew, basil,dill are grown for{culinary}and {medicinal}purposes as they were before the advent of modern medicines. The{hedgerow}habitats are gradually being destroyed by some farmers whilst others are replanting trees to {replenish}the timber stock.This area is on the edge of the vast{Thetford {Forest.}In the North East corner is an area of{Fen}and{peat}which is used for fuel.
